intro: Seselinia elata, commonly known as the tall sesel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Seselinia elata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
